Please click <a href="https://2017-2021.state.gov/secretary-pompeos-travel-to-canada/#_blank">here</a> for more information.</p><p><strong>9:15 a.m.</strong> <strong>LOCAL</strong> Secretary Pompeo meets with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, in Ottawa, Canada.</p><p><strong>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</strong></p><p><strong>10:05 a.m.</strong> <strong>LOCAL</strong> Secretary Pompeo meets withCanadian business leaders, in Ottawa, Canada.</p><p><strong>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</strong></p><p><strong>11:15 a.m.</strong> <strong>LOCAL</strong> Secretary Pompeo participates in a Wreath Laying Ceremony with Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland, in Ottawa, Canada.</p><p><strong>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</strong></p><p><strong>11:30 a.m.</strong> <strong>LOCAL</strong> Secretary Pompeo meets with Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland, in Ottawa, Canada.</p><p><strong>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</strong></p><p><strong>11:45 a.m.</strong> <strong>LOCAL</strong> Secretary Pompeo participates ina working lunch hosted by Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland, in Ottawa, Canada.</p><p><strong>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</strong></p><p><strong>1:00 p.m. LOCAL</strong> Secretary Pompeo participates in a joint press availability with Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland, in Ottawa, Canada.</p><p><strong>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</strong></p><p><strong>3:00 p.m.</strong> <strong>LOCAL</strong> Secretary Pompeo meets with staff and families ofU.S. Embassy Ottawa, in Ottawa, Canada.</p><p><strong>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT BOTTOM)</strong></p><p><strong><u>DEPUTY SECRETARY JOHN SULLIVAN</u></strong></p><p>Deputy Secretary Sullivan attends meetings and briefings, at the Department of State.</p><p><strong><u>USAID ADMINISTRATOR MARK GREEN</u></strong></p><p>Administrator Green is on travel to the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Israel, and Nigeria from August 16-24. Please click<a href="https://2017-2021.state.gov/secretary-pompeos-travel-to-amman-baghdad-erbil-cairo-manama-abu-dhabi-doha-riyadh-muscat-and-kuwait-city/">here</a>for more information.</p><p><b>6:20 p.m. LOCAL</b>Secretary Pompeo meets with UAE Foreign Minister Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan, in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>7:00 p.m. LOCAL</b>Secretary Pompeo meets with Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan and Emirati Foreign Minister Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan, in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates.<br><b>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</b></p>

SULLIVAN</b></p><p><b>4:00 p.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan delivers remarks and hosts a reception honoring recipients of the 2018 Secretary’s Award for Corporate Excellence, at the Department of State.<br><b>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><i>Preset time for video cameras is 3:00 p.m. from 23<sup>rd</sup>Street entrance.</i></p><p><i>Preset time for writers and still photographers is 3:30 p.m. from the 23<sup>rd</sup>Street entrance.</i></p><p><b>UNDER SECRETARY FOR POLITICAL AFFAIRS DAVID HALE</b></p><p><b>10:00 a.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale officiates the Swearing-in Ceremony for U.S. Ambassador–designate to the Republic of Moldova Dereck Hogan, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>2:00 p.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale officiates the 149<sup>th</sup>Foreign Service Specialist Orientation Swearing-in Ceremony, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>2:45 p.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with Turkish Ambassador to the United States Serdar Kilic, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>4:00 p.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with General Joseph Votel, Commander U.S. Central Command, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>UNDER SECRETARY FOR ARMS CONTROL AND INTERNATIONAL SECURITY ANDREA THOMPSON</b></p><p>Under Secretary Thompson has no public appointments.</p><p><b>ACTING UNDER SECRETARY FOR PUBLIC DIPLOMACY AND PUBLIC AFFAIRS &amp; DEPARTMENT SPOKESPERSON HEATHER NAUERT</b></p><p>Acting Under Secretary and Spokesperson Nauert accompanies Secretary Pompeo on travel to Tokyo, Japan; Pyongyang, DPRK; Seoul, Republic of Korea; and Beijing, China from October 5 – 8.</p><p><b>ACTING UNDER SECRETARY FOR ECONOMIC GROWTH, ENERGY, AND THE ENVIRONMENT MANISHA SINGH</b></p><p><b>4:00 p.m.</b>Acting Under Secretary Singh attends and presents the 2018 Secretary of State’s Award for Corporate Excellence, at the Department of State.<br><b>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR AFRICAN AFFAIRS TIBOR P. NAGY</b></p><p><b>11:00 a.m.</b>Assistant Secretary Nagy meets with South African Ambassador to the United States Mninwa Johannes Mahlangu, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>4:00 p.m.</b>Assistant Secretary Nagy participates in the 2018 Secretary’s Award for Corporate Excellence (ACE) Ceremony and Reception, at the Department of State.<br><b>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR INTERNATIONAL NARCOTICS AND LAW ENFORCEMENT AFFAIRS KIRSTEN MADISON</b></p><p><b>2:00 p.m.</b>Assistant Secretary Madison takes part in the annual meeting of the Major Cities Chiefs Association (MCCA), in Orlando, Florida.</p><p><b>4:00 p.m.</b>Assistant Secretary Madison hosts a reception for leaders of U.S. and foreign law enforcement agencies that partner with the Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs, in Orlando, Florida.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR ARMS CONTROL, VERIFICATION AND COMPLIANCE YLEEM S. D. POBLETE</b></p><p>Assistant Secretary Poblete is on travel to Jerusalem from October 1 – 5.</p><p><b>PRINCIPAL DEPUTY ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR EAST ASIAN AND PACIFIC AFFAIRS PATRICK MURPHY</b></p><p>Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary Murphy accompanies Secretary Pompeo on travel to Tokyo, Japan; Pyongyang, DPRK; Seoul, Republic of Korea; and Beijing, China from October 5 – 8.</p>

September 26, 2018	<p align="center"><strong>*THE PUBLIC SCHEDULE IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE*</strong></p><p><b>DEPARTMENT OF STATE<br>PUBLIC SCHEDULE<br>WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 26, 2018</b></p><p><b>SECRETARY MICHAEL R. POMPEO</b></p><p>Secretary Pompeo follows President Trump’s schedule.</p><p><b>8:30 a.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo meets with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>10:00 a.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo joins President Donald Trump at a UN Security Council meeting on counterproliferation at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE UNITED NATIONS)</b></p><p><b>10:45 a.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo meets with Democratic People’s Republic of Korea Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho at the United Nations, in New York City.‎<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)‎</b></p><p><b>5:00 p.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo attends President Donald Trump’s press conference at the Palace Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE WHITE HOUSE)</b></p><p><b>DEPUTY SECRETARY JOHN SULLIVAN</b></p><p><b>9:00 a.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan participates in the Global Counter Terrorism Forum Ministerial at the Roosevelt Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>10:30 a.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan meets with Argentine Foreign Minister Jorge Faurie at the Palace Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>12:30 p.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan meets with Qatari Foreign Minister Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani at the Qatari Mission, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>2:30 p.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan meets with Vietnamese Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs Pham Binh Minh at the Permanent Mission of Vietnam, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>6:00 p.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan attends a reception with European and UN Partners at the Delegation of the European Union to the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>USAID ADMINISTRATOR MARK GREEN</b></p><p><b>10:00 a.m.</b>Administrator Green attends the First Lady’s Reception for Delegation Spouses, at the U.S. Mission to the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE WHITE HOUSE)</b></p><p><b>12:30 p.m.</b>Administrator Green meets with Bangladesh Foreign Secretary Shahidul Haque at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>1:30 p.m.</b>Administrator Green delivers remarks at the Accelerating Action on Tuberculosis Towards Achieving 40×22 event at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE UNITED NATIONS)</b></p><p><b>2:45 p.m.</b>Administrator Green participates in the High-Level Meeting on Tuberculosis at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE UNITED NATIONS)</b></p><p><b>4:00 p.m.</b>Administrator Green meets with Liberian President George Weah at the Palace Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>UNDER SECRETARY FOR POLITICAL AFFAIRS DAVID HALE</b></p><p><b>9:30 a.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with Yemeni Special Envoy Martin Griffiths, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>10:30 a.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with European External Action Service Secretary General Helga Schmid, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>12:30 p.m</b>. Under Secretary Hale meets with Kazakh Foreign Minister Kairat Abdrakhmanov at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>2:30 p.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with UN Special Envoy for Syria Staffan de Mistura at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE UNITED NATIONS)</b></p><p><b>3:30 p.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with Papua New Guinean Foreign Minister Rimbink Pato at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>4:30 p.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with UN Under Secretary General for Political Affairs Rosemary DiCarlo at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE UNITED NATIONS)</b></p><p><b>ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR EDUCATIONAL AND CULTURAL AFFAIRS MARIE ROYCE</b></p><p><b>6:00 p.m.</b>Assistant Secretary Royce delivers remarks at the 2018 American Council of Young Political Leaders Honors Evening at the American Gas Association, in Washington D.C.<br><b>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p>****</p><p>Acting Under Secretary for Public Diplomacy and Public Affairs and Department Spokesperson Heather Nauert, Under Secretary for Arms Control and International Security Andrea Thompson, Acting Assistant Secretary for Population, Refugees, and Migration Carol T. O’Connell, Assistant Secretary for European and Eurasian Affairs A. Wess Mitchell, Acting Assistant Secretary for Near Eastern Affairs David Satterfield, Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary for East Asian and Pacific Affairs Patrick Murphy, Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asian Affairs Alice Wells, Assistant Secretary for African Affairs Tibor Nagy, Acting Assistant Secretary for Western Hemisphere Affairs Francisco Palmieri, Assistant Secretary for International Organization Affairs Kevin Moley, Assistant Secretary for Energy Resources Francis R. Fannon, Ambassador-at-Large for International Religious Freedom Sam Brownback, Special Presidential Envoy for the Global Coalition to Defeat ISIS Brett McGurk, and U.S. Global AIDS Coordinator and U.S. Special Representative for Global Health Diplomacy Ambassador-at-Large Deborah L. Birx attend meetings and events surrounding the United Nations General Assembly, in New York City.</p>
September 25, 2018	<p align="center"><strong>*THE PUBLIC SCHEDULE IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE*</strong></p><p><b>DEPARTMENT OF STATE<br>PUBLIC SCHEDULE<br>SEPTEMBER 25, 2018</b></p><p><b>TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 25, 2018</b></p><p><b>SECRETARY MICHAEL R. POMPEO</b></p><p>Secretary Pompeo follows President Trump’s schedule.</p><p><b>10:15 a.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo attends President Donald Trump’s address to the 73rd Session of the United Nations General Assembly at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE UNITED NATIONS)</b></p><p><b>1:15 p.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo joins President Donald Trump at a working luncheon hosted by the Secretary-General of the United Nations Antonio Guterres at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE UNITED NATIONS)</b></p><p><b>3:40 p.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo delivers remarks at the United Against Nuclear Iran Summit at the Westin Grand Central Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</b><br><i>Pre-set time for all press (video cameras, photographers, and writers) is 2:30 p.m. in the Ambassador Room.</i></p><p><b>6:00 p.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo joins President Donald Trump and Ambassador Nikki Haley at the Security Council Presidency Reception at the U.S. Mission to the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>7:00 p.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo hosts a Transatlantic Dinner at the Palace Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>DEPUTY SECRETARY JOHN SULLIVAN</b></p><p><b>8:30 a.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan meets with Ukrainian Foreign Minister Pavlo Klimkin at theUnited Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>12:30 p.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan joins Vice President Pence at a Colombia-hosted event “Towards a Comprehensive Response for the Venezuelan Migration” at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>7:15 p.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan participates in a Lima Group Meeting at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>USAID ADMINISTRATOR MARK GREEN</b></p><p><b>2:00 p.m.</b>Administrator Green delivers remarks at the Concordia Summit “The Journey to Self Reliance” event at the Grand Hyatt, in New York City.<br>The event will be livestreamed at<a href="https://www.concordia.net/live/" class="external-link"><span in the Humanitarian Grand Challenge roundtable event with Department for International Development Secretary Penny Mordaunt at the Grand Hyatt, in New York City.<br><b>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>5:00 p.m.</b>Administrator Green meets with United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization Director-General José Graziano da Silva at the Grand Hyatt in New York City, New York.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>6:10 p.m.</b>Administrator Green participates in the “Breaking the Cycle Between Conflict and Hunger” event at the United Nations, in New York City.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY HOST)</b></p><p><b>UNDER SECRETARY FOR POLITICAL AFFAIRS DAVID HALE</b></p><p><b>9:00 a.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with UN Personal Envoy for Western Sahara COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>2:00 p.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with Indian Foreign Secretary Vijay Keshav Gokhale, in New York City.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>5:45 p.m.</b>Under Secretary Hale meets with UN High Commissioner for Refugees Filippo Grandi, in New York City.<br>(<b>CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>PRINCIPAL DEPUTY ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR OCEANS AND INTERNATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND SCIENTIFIC AFFAIRS JUDITH GARBER</b></p><p><b>3:30 p.m.</b>Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary Garber meets with Icelandic Environment and Natural Resources Minister Gudmundur Ingi Gudbrandsson, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p>****</p><p>Acting Under Secretary for Public Diplomacy and Public Affairs and Department Spokesperson DEPARTMENT</b><b>SPOKESPERSON HEATHER NAUERT</b></p><p>Acting Under Secretary and Spokesperson Nauert accompanies Secretary Pompeo on travel to Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, and Jakarta from August 1–5.</p><p><b>ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR AFRICAN AFFAIRS TIBOR NAGY</b></p><p><b>6:00 p.m.</b>Assistant Secretary Nagy gives remarks at the African Union Diaspora Young Leaders Summit Closing Dinner, at the InterContinental-The Wharf Hotel, in Washington, DC.<br><b>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR EDUCATIONAL AND CULTURAL AFFAIRS MARIE ROYCE</b></p><p><b>10:00 a.m.</b>Assistant Secretary Royce meets with representatives from the Texas International Education Consortium, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>CHIEF OF PROTOCOL SEAN LAWLER</b></p><p><b>2:00 p.m.</b>Ambassador Lawler hosts a farewell reception for the Ambassador of the Slovak Republic, H. E. Peter Kmec, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>DEPUTY ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR EAST ASIAN AND PACIFIC AFFAIRS PATRICK MURPHY</b></p><p>Deputy Assistant Secretary Murphy accompanies Secretary Pompeo on travel to Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, and Jakarta from August 1–5.</p>

May 31, 2018	<p align="center"><strong>***THE PUBLIC SCHEDULE IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE***</strong></p><p><b><strong>DEPARTMENT OF STATE</strong><br><strong>PUBLIC SCHEDULE</strong></b><br><strong>THURSDAY</strong><b><strong>, MAY 31, 2018</strong></b></p><p><strong>SECRETARY MIKE POMPEO</strong></p><p>Secretary Pompeo is on travel to New York City, NY, from May 30-31.</p><p><strong>9:00 a.m.</strong>Secretary Pompeo meets with DPRK Vice-Chairman of the Central Committee Kim Yong Chol, in New York City, NY.<br><strong>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</strong></p><p><strong>2:15 p.m.</strong>Secretary Pompeo holds a press availability in the Spellman Room at the Lotte New York Palace Hotel, in New York City, NY.<br><strong>(OPEN PRESS COVERAGE)</strong><br><i>Preset time for video cameras and still photographers: 12:00 p.m.<br>Final access time for journalists without equipment: 1:15 p.m.<br>Please note that due to security procedures, anyone arriving after the set times may be declined access to the event.</i></p><p><strong>DEPUTY SECRETARY JOHN SULLIVAN</strong></p><p>Deputy Secretary Sullivan attends meetings and briefings at the Department of State.</p><p><strong>UNDER SECRETARY FOR POLITICAL AFFAIRS THOMAS SHANNON</strong></p><p>Under Secretary Shannon attends meetings and briefings, at the Department of State.</p><p><strong>ACTING UNDER SECRETARY FOR PUBLIC DIPLOMACY AND PUBLIC AFFAIRS &amp; DEPARTMENT SPOKESPERSON HEATHER NAUERT</strong></p><p>Acting Under Secretary and Spokesperson Nauert accompanies Secretary Pompeo on travel to New York City, NY.</p><p><b><strong>ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR ECONOMIC AND BUSINESS AFFAIRS MANISHA SINGH</strong></b></p><p>Assistant Secretary Singh travels to Paris, France for the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Ministerial Council Meeting from May 29-31.</p><p><strong>PRINCIPAL DEPUTY ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR POLITICAL-MILITARY AFFAIRS TINA KAIDANOW</strong></p><p>Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary Kaidanow is on travel to Germany, Japan, India, and Singapore from May 20-June 3.</p>
May 30, 2018	<p align="center"><strong>***THE PUBLIC SCHEDULE IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE***</strong></p><p><b><strong>DEPARTMENT OF STATE</strong><br><strong>PUBLIC SCHEDULE<br>WEDNESDAY, MAY 30, 2018</strong></b></p><p><b><i>UPDATE</i></b><i>:</i><b><i>7:00 p.m.</i></b><i>Secretary Pompeo hosts a working dinner for North Korean Vice-Chairman Kim ‎Yong Chol, in New York, NY.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></i></p><p><strong>SECRETARY MIKE POMPEO</strong></p><p><b>10:00 a.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo meets with Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</b><br><i>Preset time for video cameras: 9:15 a.m. from 23rd Street Entrance Lobby.<br>Final access time for journalists and still photographers: 9:30 a.m. from the 23rd Street Entrance Lobby.</i></p><p><b>2:00 p.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo meets with President Donald Trump, at the White House.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY THE WHITE HOUSE)</b></p><p><b>7:00 p.m.</b>Secretary Pompeo hosts a working dinner for North Korean Vice-Chairman Kim ‎Yong Chol, in New York, NY.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>DEPUTY SECRETARY JOHN SULLIVAN</b></p><p><b>4:00 p.m.</b>Deputy Secretary Sullivan meets with Swedish State Secretary Annika Söder, at the Department of State.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>USAID ADMINISTRATOR MARK GREEN</b></p><p><b>2:00 p.m</b>. Professional Fellows from the ASEAN region are also part of the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative (YSEALI).<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>PRINCIPAL DEPUTY ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR POLITICAL-MILITARY AFFAIRS TINA KAIDANOW</b></p><p>Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary Kaidanow is on travel to Germany, Japan, India, and Singapore from May 20-June 3.</p>

September 22, 2017	<p><strong>DEPARTMENT OF STATE<br>PUBLIC SCHEDULE<br>SEPTEMBER 22, 2017</strong></p><p>The Department of State’s Office of Press Relations for the 72nd United Nations General Assembly will be at the Palace Hotel Room 3819 and can be reached at 202-485-2018. To access the Palace Press Office, please use the Guest Elevators to the 38th floor. Members of the press must present press credentials and photo identification. Briefings to the press will be held in Room 3818 Press Office Suite throughout the week. We will provide information on these as schedules become available. For more information about media access to events at the United Nations, please call the UN Office of Media Accreditation 212-963-6934.</p><p><b>SECRETARY REX TILLERSON</b></p><p><b>7:00 a.m.</b>Secretary Tillerson appears on ABC Good Morning America, in New York City.</p><p><b>8:45 a.m.</b>Secretary Tillerson, Acting Assistant Secretary Wells meet with Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj, at the Palace Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</b></p><p><b>9:30 a.m.</b>Secretary Tillerson, Acting Assistant Secretary Satterfield, Ambassador Sales and Special Envoy McGurk participate in Shaping the Peace, The Global Coalition to Defeat ISIS Meeting on Iraq, at the Palace Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</b></p><p><b>11:00 a.m.</b>Secretary Tillerson and Acting Assistant Secretary Wells participate in C5+1 Multilateral Meeting, at the Palace Hotel, in New York City.<br><b>(POOLED CAMERA SPRAY AT TOP)</b></p><p><b>DEPUTY SECRETARY JOHN SULLIVAN</b></p><p>Deputy Secretary Sullivan attends meetings and briefings, at the Department of State.</p><p>***</p><p>Under Secretary for Political Affairs Thomas Shannon, Acting Assistant Secretary for International Organization Tracey Jacobson, Ambassador-at-Large and Coordinator for Counterterrorism Nathan Sales, Acting Assistant Secretary for Population, Refugees, and Migration Simon Henshaw, Acting Assistant Secretary for Political-Military Affairs Tina Kaidanow, Acting Assistant Secretary for European and Eurasian Affairs Elisabeth Millard, Acting Assistant Secretary for Near Eastern Affairs David Satterfield, Acting Assistant Secretary for East Asian and Pacific Affairs Susan Thornton, Acting Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asian Affairs and Acting Special Representative for Afghanistan and Pakistan Alice Wells, Acting Assistant Secretary for African Affairs Donald Y. Yamamoto, Acting Assistant Secretary for Hemisphere Affairs Francisco (Paco) Palmieri, Special Presidential Envoy for the Global Coalition to Defeat ISIS Brett McGurk, Acting Assistant Secretary of Conflict and Stabilization Operations Tom Hushek, U.S. Global AIDS Coordinator and U.S. Special Representative for Global Health Diplomacy Ambassador-at-Large Deborah L. Birx, attend meetings and events surrounding the United Nations General Assembly, in New York City.</p>

May 24, 2017	<p><b>DEPARTMENT OF STATE</b><br><b>PUBLIC SCHEDULE<br>MAY 24, 2017</b></p><p><b>SECRETARY REX TILLERSON</b></p><p>Secretary Tillerson accompanies President Donald Trump on travel to Vatican City, Holy See, and Brussels, Belgium from May 24 through May 26.</p><p><b>UNDER SECRETARY FOR POLITICAL AFFAIRS THOMAS SHANNON</b></p><p><b>9:30 a.m.</b>Under Secretary Shannon attends a meeting, at the White House.<br><b>(MEDIA DETERMINED BY WHITE HOUSE)</b></p><p><b>ACTING ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR OCEANS AND INTERNATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND SCIENTIFIC AFFAIRS JUDITH GARBER</b></p><p>Acting Assistant Secretary Garber is on travel to Berlin, Germany from May 21 through May 25.</p><p><b>10:00 a.m. LOCAL</b>Acting Assistant Secretary Garber meets with German Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation, Building and Nuclear Safety Director General for Climate Policy, European and International Policy Karsten Sach, in Berlin, Germany.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>11:00 a.m. LOCAL</b>Acting Assistant Secretary Garber meets with German Ministry of Foreign Affairs Director of the Economic and Suitability Department Miguel Berger, in Berlin, Germany.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>2:00 p.m. LOCAL</b>Acting Assistant Secretary Garber meets with German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy Director General for Industrial Policy Dr. Wolfgang Scheremet, in Berlin, Germany.<br><b>(CLOSED PRESS COVERAGE)</b></p><p><b>ACTING ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR WESTERN HEMISPHERE AFFAIRS FRANCISCO PALMIERI</b></p><p>Acting Assistant Secretary Palmieri is on travel to the U.S. Southern Command in Miami, Florida to participate in the Chiefs of Mission conference from May 22 through May 24.</p><p><b>ACTING ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR EAST ASIAN AND PACIFIC AFFAIRS SUSAN THORNTON</b></p><p>Acting Assistant Secretary Thornton is on travel to Manila and Beijing from May 23 through May 26.</p>
